snippet: A proposal to ease testing requirements is seductive but raises concerns about safety.
abstract: Editorial contends Food And Drug Administration proposal that will lower bar for approving drugs to treat people at earliest stages of Alzheimer's disease raises troubling questions; calls on independent analysts to assess proposal and to determine whether FDA should demand very high level of proof of safety and effectiveness before exposing still-healthy people to possible harm.
lead_paragraph: A proposal to ease testing requirements is seductive but raises concerns about safety.
